name: The Lost
storyline:
The Lost draws strong inspiration from Dante Alighieri's Divine Comedy, particularly Inferno. Set in the present day, the story follows Amanda Wright, a waitress and medical student grappling with the recent tragic loss of her only daughter, Beatrice, in a car accident. As a single mother in deep despair, Amanda finds herself on the brink of suicide and, in desperation, strikes a deal with the devil. She trades her soul for a chance to descend into a hellish underworld resembling a brutal concentration camp, all in an attempt to save her daughter’s soul.

Within this infernal realm, Amanda is joined by Virgil, an unusual reptilian creature who becomes her guide after she frees him from an enchanted sword. Alongside Virgil, she encounters four powerful beings, known as the Entities, each offering unique strengths. These Entities allow Amanda to shift identities, each with its own skills and abilities:

• Shadow: A stealthy, thief-like figure skilled in evasion and deception.
• Light: A protective healer adept in defensive magic.
• Corruption: A frail but formidable mage specializing in destructive spells.
• Instinct: A fierce, sword-wielding fighter with expertise in close combat.
Each Entity provides a distinct advantage as Amanda navigates the perils of hell in her relentless quest to save Beatrice’s soul.
summary: The Lost was an action adventure/survival horror game co-developed by Irrational Games (the makers of Bioshock) and FXLabs. Set to be released in 2002 for the Playstation 2 and Xbox game consoles, The Lost went through several phases of development hell until it was cancelled. FXLabs bought everything related to The Lost in 2008 and finished the game, releasing it as AGNI on PC.
